text: William Orser Holmes (February 9, 1899 – March 14, 1961) was a Canadian ice hockey centre who played in the National Hockey League (NHL) for the Montreal Canadiens and the New York Americans. Born in Portage la Prairie, a city in the Central Plains Region of Manitoba. ==External links== * Category:1899 births Category:1961 deaths Category:Canadian expatriate ice hockey players in the United States Category:Canadian ice hockey centres Category:Cleveland Indians (IHL) players Category:Edmonton Eskimos (ice hockey) players Category:Ice hockey people from Manitoba Category:London Panthers players Category:Montreal Canadiens players Category:New York Americans players Category:Niagara Falls Cataracts players Category:Pittsburgh Shamrocks players Category:Pittsburgh Yellow Jackets (IHL) players Category:Place of death missing Category:Sportspeople from Portage la Prairie
title: Bill Holmes (ice hockey)
